data.title: Our top 10 facts about elephants
data.meta_description: Elephants are the world's largest land mammals, with males weighing up to six tonnes on average. And their trunks have some mad skills!
data.text:
© Bea Binka

© Austine Okande / WWF-Kenya

WWF's work

We collaborate with partners, governments, and communities in east Africa and across Asia to protect elephant populations and their habitats. This includes maintaining and restoring ‘wildlife corridors’ so elephants can migrate safely.

We also support local people to live more safely alongside wildlife, including strategies to reduce crop damage from elephants, such as using solar powered electric fences and installing beehives (as elephants dislike bees).

© Thomas Cristofoletti / WWF-US
